content: I've been using a mapping app on my phone to navigate during my road trips, and it's been very helpful in finding the best routes and avoiding traffic jams. However, I've noticed that my phone's battery life has been a challenge on long road trips, so I've started carrying a portable charger and using it to top up my phone's battery whenever we stop. Do you think a car charger with a high amperage output would be a good investment for me, or would a portable power bank be more convenient?
